questions.prompt: If R_in = 10·R_S, what fraction of V_S appears as V_in?
An amplifier with A_V=20 and V_CC=±15V will clip when V_in exceeds:
questions.explanation: Clipping occurs when A_V×V_in > V_CC. So V_in > 15/20 = 0.75V.

questions.prompt: If GBP = 1 MHz and gain = 100, the bandwidth is:
Maximum theoretical efficiency of a Class A amplifier with resistive load:
questions.explanation: Class A with resistive load has max η = 25%. With transformer coupling, max is 50%.

questions.prompt: An amplifier with R_out=1kΩ and R_L=4kΩ delivers what fraction of ideal output?
Which technology typically has the highest input impedance?
questions.explanation: FET-input op-amps have R_in up to 10¹² Ω. MOSFETs also have very high R_in due to gate insulation.

questions.prompt: Total gain with R_in=50kΩ, R_S=5kΩ, A_V=100, R_out=2kΩ, R_L=8kΩ is:
Small-signal operation keeps THD below approximately:
questions.explanation: Small-signal operation linearizes the transistor characteristics, keeping total harmonic distortion well under 1%.

questions.prompt: An emitter follower (CC) typically has R_out of approximately:
questions.explanation: The CC configuration has very low R_out, typically around r_e = V_T/I_C ≈ 25mV/2.5mA = 10Ω.

questions.prompt: Doubling the gain of an amplifier while maintaining GBP constant will:
questions.explanation: If GBP is constant: BW = GBP/Gain. Doubling gain halves BW.
